title: Can we not do to Rek'sai what we did to Darius?
body:
On release Darius was overpowered. Not OMG THIS IS SO BROKEN overpowered, but overpowered. Much like Rek'sai is right now. Like Rek'sai they nerfed the AD ratio on his passive from 0.4 to 0.3 (they're nerfing Rek'sai's Q to 0.3 from 0.4.)

The problem? Much like Darius this is just going to cause end game woes for Rek'sai while doing little to curb the early game power that Rek'sai commands. Like Darius this will just discourage damage builds and focus more on full tank builds or trinity/full tank builds. Like Darius this is not a satisfying nerf that will leave an incredible laning phase and a weak late game. 

I know Riot sees melee building damage and immediately thinks "WHY NOT FULL TANK?" but maybe we can leave in some AD ratios and weaken their early game a bit to smooth over the early->late game transition? Not every bruiser needs to be a laning phase bully. Did nerfing Darius's AD ratios work? Did nerfing Yorick's AD ratios work? Did nerfing Jax's AD ratios work? Did nerfing Garen's AD ratios work? Did nerfing Kha'zix's AD ratios work? Did nerfing Malphite's armor ratio work? Did nerfing Shen's AP ratios work? Did nerfing Rammus's armor ratios work? Did nerfing Mordekaiser's AP ratios work? did nerfing Rengar's AD ratios work? I could go on but I'm bored.

Either way point stands: Riot always jumps on nerfing the AD ratios because for some unknown reason they just believe that trinity/full tank is the way to go for bruisers, and if they weren't dominant in the laning phase that they'd be bad design. If we lopped 20 damage off Rek'sai's Q (-0/-5/-10/-15/-20 at rank 1-5 respectively) it would amount to a much more reasonable nerf than removing 0.3 AD ratio total off the ability and would actually achieve what you want to achieve.

Also why the hell are you reducing the AP ratio on her Q? Does it really annoy you so much that people build AP on champions you don't want them to that you will go out of your way to hound people down who want to have a little fun? "Oh hey, Rek'sai has a 1.0 AP ratio on her Q, I'm gonna go AP Rek'sai cause that might be funny!" Then suddenly Riot comes down in a black helicopter and punches them in the face and says "WHAT THE FUCK ARE YOU DOING KID? YOU PLAY HER TRINITY FULL TANK I WILL END YOU IF YOU BUILD AP ON A CHAMPION WE DIDN'T EAR MARK FOR AP ITEMS!"

This seems more like Rengar then Darius. Rek'Sai is obviously a champion they made for the jungle, a strong AoE, gap closers, a form of sustain it's all there. But like Rengar, what can be strong in the jungle can also be strong in the top lane. When he first came out Rengar was pretty good in the jungle, not Lee Sin meta levels but he wasn't Warwick levels of bad (Warwick back then) so he was an ok pick. Sadly, his kit was stronger in top lane than in the jungle so Riot nerfed him several times to keep him in line and only afterwards saw what they did to Jungle Rengar (spoiler, it was closer to Warwick level). 

But for how Riot nerfed her, I can see what they're going for. They don't want to hurt her jungling at all, and since the first clear is a "make or break" point, they really can't hurt the base damage of Queen's Wrath. As for Prey Seeker's nerf, I personally couldn't care less. I play Rek'Sai as a bruiser jungler and never get any AP, not even Trinity Force unless insanely fed. And personally, I am not a fan of any champion having a 100% scaling as that can escalate quickly. But if they had to nerf her damage I would have rather they nerf Unburrow as you want that for the CC, not the damage. 

All in all, Rek'Sai isn't OP, people are just having a hard time catching her as she is highly mobile. Once the community starts to settle down and learn how to counter her (cough) Ward (cough) kill tunnels (cough) than she would seem much less OP.

Also, your counterargument makes no sense, as 90% of these champions are NOTHING even REMOTELY similar to Rek.

Urgot is well-acknowledged to be in a terrible spot.

Jayce is ranged, with nidalee levels of poke.  Also, has 2 speed boosts, and a knockback to disengage from melee.

Cass is ranged, and suffers from a failwork (although I haven't had enough time to formulate an opinion of where it stands as of this patch)

MF is ranged with a very heavy slow, but suffers from not being able to do anything better than any of the other ADCs.

Anivia has incredibly long range, and very powerful AoE denial abilities that zone you away from things.  Aside from her crippling mana, she tends to be a fairly safe champion to play once she gets rolling.

Galio, a heavy duty tank with a movement speed boost, but is in a pretty bad spot because he doesn't have a hard engage or disengage.

Fiddle......is a jungler and is (for the most part) in a fine spot.....he is NOTHING, and I do mean NOTHING like rek'sai, completely different playstyle.

Heimer....he has his turrets for his defense.  If he was given a hard disengage he would be ungodly broken.

Darius............is currently viewed as being in a terrible spot and is slated for a rework (no one knows when its happening, only that it will be happening at some point).

Rek's tunnels aren't the problem really, not when compared to the REST of the roster (and more importantly, the TOP LANE CHAMPIONS).  The real problem are her base damages, which cannot be nerfed without destroying her jungling ability.
